owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Buildings in which money or valuable objects are stored or preserved. These usually incorporate security features into their design. Examples are found in Classical Greece and Rome.

Schathuizen zijn kleine offergebouwtjes uit de klassieke oudheid, waarin verschillende steden offergiften plaatsten. Bovendien vormden de gebouwtjes zelf ook een offergave en teken van devotie aan de goden. Schathuizen hadden doorgaans een eenvoudige plattegrond: een rechthoekige doos met een portaal met twee klassieke zuilen, vaak aan de buitenkant herkenbaar door de klassieke bouworde.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: schathuis
schathuizen
schathuizen (tempels)
treasuries (buildings)

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Houder of arm waarin het doopbekken rust. Dikwijls aan de kuip of trap van de preekstoel bevestigd.

Supports of various design for the baptismal font, particularly for basin-style fonts. Examples include tabletop supports and metal supports mounted on a wall or other church architecture. For holders of baptismal fonts that rest on the floor, use "baptismal font stands."
owl:Class.rdfs:label: baptismal font supports
doopbekkenhouder
doopbekkenhouders

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Staander van hout of metaal, waarop het doopbekken rust.
Stands of various designs that rest on the floor or ground and support the baptismal font. For tabletop or wall-mounted supports for the baptismal font, use "baptismal font supports."
owl:Class.rdfs:label: baptismal font stands
doopbekkenstandaard
doopbekkenstandaarden

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Metalen boog - meestal van geelkoper - boven de doorgang in het doophek naar de dooptuin.

Spaces in a church marked by an arch, usually as the entrance to an apse or chapel, coinciding with the part of the building containing a font for the baptismal rite. The open space beneath the arch may be spanned by a gate, grillwork, or door.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: baptistery arches
doopbogen
doopboog

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Metalen of houten hek ter afsluiting van de dooptuin of doopkapel.

Screens separating the baptismal font and area from the rest of the church; may comprise a solid screen, open screen work, or a railing. For separate structures or chapels used for baptisms, use "baptistries."
owl:Class.rdfs:label: baptismal screens
doophek
doophekken

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Kerkbank voor de leden van het Hof. De identiteit van de hofleden kan worden afgeleid van het snijwerk en het familiewapen.
Pews in a church reserved for the royal family; the pews may be set up on a high platform or otherwise decorated and designated as belonging to the monarch or family.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: hofbank
hofbanken
royal pews

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Altars in Catholic churches installed after the Second Vatican Council (1962-1965) in accordance with new mandates that the altar should be table-like and placed far enough away from the wall so that the celebrant could face the congregation rather than have his back to them. Churches dating before the 1960s may retain the structures of the original high altars that are nearer the wall and having ornate superstructures, although they are no longer used for celebrating the mass. Altars from other periods and other faiths may be similar in design to council altars; the distinction is the context in which the council altar was installed.

Ter onderscheiding van het oude hoogaltaar tegen de oostwand van het koor, waaraan de priester met de rug naar het volk de mis opdroeg, wordt de term gebruikt voor het meer centraal geplaatste altaar waaraan de priester met het gezicht naar de kerkgangers de eucharistie met het volk viert.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: council altars (Roman Catholic church)
dienstaltaar
dienstaltaren

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Antependium in de liturgische kleur van de dag dat wordt geplaatst aan de voorzijde van de kaarsenbank.
Coverings of cloth or other material used to decorate or cover the gradine or altar ledge of the altar in Christian churches.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: gradine covers
kaarsenbankantependia
kaarsenbankantependium

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Stools or other types of simple seats in the choir of a church, used by acolytes or other assistants of the celebrant.
Zetels, soms opvouwbaar, bedoeld voor de misdienaren. De misdienaarskrukken maken soms ook deel uit van de set van kerkgestoelte.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: acolyte seats
misdienaarskruk
misdienaarskrukken

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Chairs of various designs, positioned at the front of certain Protestant churches and used by the preacher during services. For chairs having a tall back surmounted by a lectern and used as a pulpit, use "preaching chairs."

Zetel, veelal in de nabijheid van de liturgische tafel, waarop de predikant plaatsneemt tijdens momenten van rust in de dienst, zoals tijdens het zingen van een lied, tijdens de collectes en wanneer iemand anders dan de predikant een lezing verricht. Vaak wordt ook met een stoel genoegen genomen.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: preacher's chairs (presider's chairs)
predikantenzetel
predikantenzetels

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Mobile hospitals that treat sick or wounded people. These may be for military personnel in combat zones or for use by health workers in any emergency situation, such as an epidemic.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: field hospitals

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Niches having a shelf or flat surface, found in churches and used for the placement of vessels used in the Eucharist prior to use and immediately afterwards.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: credence niches

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Shelves found in churches and used for the placement of vessels used in the Eucharist prior to use and immediately afterwards.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: credence shelves

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Klein gebouw op een begraafplaats waar doden werden opgebaard. In sommige landen werd aan het eind van de 19e eeuw op iedere begraafplaats de aanwezigheid verplicht gesteld van een huisje waar overledenen aan besmettelijke ziekten opgeslagen konden worden.

Structures, usually in cemeteries, designed to temporarily store the bodies of the deceased prior to interment in a permanent grave or tomb. They may include chambers dug into hillsides or free standing structures. Examples are receiving vaults used during winter months in climates where the ground may be frozen. For rooms or structures used for the hygienic temporary storage of corpses, not designed for visitation by mourners, prefer "morgues."
owl:Class.rdfs:label: baarhuis
baarhuizen
receiving vaults (funerary structures)

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Buildings in India specifically used as assemblies for Shiite Muslims to gather during Muharram.
Gebouwen in India die specifiek tijdens Muharram worden gebruikt als congregatiehal voor sjiitische moslims.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: hussainia
hussainia's
imambaras

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Buildings designed to be identical or closely resemble each other, often built in succession or at the same time, so that they may be constructed quickly and efficiently. Examples are suburban housing developments and factory-produced housing kits.

Verwijst naar gebouwen die zodanig zijn ontwerpen dat ze identiek zijn of erg op elkaar lijken. Vaak worden ze ten bate van snelheid en efficiëntie vlak na elkaar of tegelijkertijd gebouwd. Voorbeelden zijn huizenprojecten in buitenwijken en fabrieksmatig geproduceerde bouwpakketten.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: serial buildings
seriebouw

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Buildings housing state legislatures in the U.S. states.
Gebouwen waarin in Amerikaanse staten het wetgevend lichaam van de staat gevestigd is.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: staatskapitolen
staatskapitool
state capitols

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: In modern casual, common usage, any structures along a body of water intended to support people or their activities, such as boarding a boat or unloading cargo. Examples include piers and wharves. Distinguished from "docks (waterfront spaces)," which are spaces where ships dock.

In modern, alledaags gebruik verwijst de term naar constructies langs het water die bedoeld zijn ter ondersteuning van mensen en hun activiteiten, zoals het aanleggen van een boot of het lossen van een lading. Voorbeelden zijn aanlegsteigers en werven. Te onderscheiden van 'dokken': ruimten waar schepen afmeren.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: docks (general waterside structures)
dokken
dokken (algemene oeverconstructies)
kades
kades (algemene oeverconstructies)

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Sluizen waardoor men overtollig water uit een kanaal kan lozen.

Subsidiary built waterways for redirecting the water of a river or canal, provided with an adjustable gate or gates by which the volume of water is regulated or controlled. These are commonly used for low discharges; use "sluices" for structures that regulate higher discharges of water.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: outlet sluices
suatiesluizen
uitwateringssluis
uitwateringssluizen
zijlen

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Atars in the form of a table.
Hoge monumentale tafel die als altaar in gebruik is.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: altaartafel
altaartafels
altar tables
mensa's

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Industrial facilities dedicated to the large-scale production of food products prepared by moistening, kneading, and baking flour or meal into bread or similar products. For buildings or parts of buildings where bread and other baked goods are prepared, and that may include a space for the retail sale of baked goods, use "bakeries."
Instellingen voor het (machinale) bakken van brood op grote schaal.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: bread factories
broodfabriek
broodfabrieken

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Een windmolen die water van een lager niveau in een polder naar een hoger niveau verzet.
Windmill used to power the pumping of water from a polder, which is low-lying land reclaimed from the sea, to a drainage network.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: polder mills
poldermolen
poldermolens

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Kelders of vertrekken met koelvoorzieningen waar de melk tijdens de uitroming wordt neergezet.
Subterranean spaces of larger structures where raw milk is put to separate from the cream layer. For dedicated structures designated for similar purposes use "milk houses."
owl:Class.rdfs:label: melkkelder
melkkelders
milk cellars

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Hallen of overdekte halfopen ruimten waar patiënten in het eerste stadium van de tuberculose moesten kuren.

Sanatoriums devoted to the treatment of tuberculosis, usually dating to the 19th and early 20th centuries. The facilities were typically located in a rural environment, with large windows and sunning porches, large enough to house dozens or hundreds of patients.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: lighal
lighallen
tuberculosis sanatoriums

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Gebouwen die hun oorsprong kennen in de Middeleeuwen als handels- en stapelplaats voor het laken (wollen stoffen). In sommige plaatsen vonden er ook keuringen plaats, en werd de kwaliteit van het laken bevestigd door de toekenning van een lakenlood.

Large buildings that that are intended as markets and warehouses for cloth. These spaces originated in the Middle Ages and evolved into spaces where brokers and dealers arranged international sales of wool and finished cloth, and local merchants bought and sold wool, thread, and cloth in varied stages of production.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cloth halls
lakenhal
lakenhallen

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Buildings with oasts where madder was dried and pulverized to obtain the reddish-purple dye obtained from the plant's roots.
Gebouwen met eesten waar de meekrap werd gedroogd en fijngestampt.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: madder mills
meekrapstoof
meekrapstoven

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Barrier on waterways such as rivers, lakes or at the seashore that incorporate sluices for controlling water levels to prevent flooding or to harness water power. For hydraulic structures that connect higher and lower sections of artificial waterways for transferring watercraft from one level to another, use 'locks.'
Enkele sluizen die de hogere waterstand bij havens, dokken en andere waterwerken tegenhouden.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: control locks
keersluis
keersluizen

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Artificial water courses in recreation areas that may include varied elements simulating rapids, caves, waterfalls, or chutes.
Kunstmatig aangelegd waterparcours met stroomversnellingen, grotten, watervallen en dergelijke. Gebruikers gaan soms van een glijbaan, en zitten soms in een bootje.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: water rides
wildwaterbaan
wildwaterbanen

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: InstallatieÂ waarmee schepen van het ene water naar het andere water wordt getrokken.
Structures or devices used to allow the transportation of a boat, goods, etc. over land between navigable bodies or stretches of water.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: overtomen
overtoom
portages (structures)

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Locations where transportation vehicles, such as buses, trains, wagons, or the like, are stored or deposited; sometimes comprises a covered structure, but may be a yard.
Wagenloodsen voor openbare (stads)vervoermiddelen, in het bijzonder voor treinen, bussen en tramwagens.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: depots (transportation facilities)
locomotievenremise
locomotievenremises
remise
remises
remises (wagenloodsen)

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Buildings housing facilities that provide electrical power to transportation systems. For buildings that gather or distribute electricity to businesses and homes, use "power plant buildings (utilities buildings)."
Gebouwen waar vervoerssystemen van elektrische drijfkracht worden voorzien.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: electrification buildings (transportation buildings)
elektrificatiegebouw
elektrificatiegebouwen

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Kapellen in of van kloosters.
Rooms or buildings for worship: oratories, that are attached to places of residence for a community living under religious vows.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: kloosterkapel
kloosterkapellen
monastery chapels

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Gebouwen waar hulpmiddelen voor brandbestrijding, zoals de handbediende brandspuiten, emmers, ladders en haken voor een buurt werden opgeborgen, als deel van een systeem van brandbestrijding waarbij de verantwoordelijkheid bij de afzonderlijke wijken van een stad werd gelegd.

Refers to relatively small buildings or sheds housing the tools for firefighting. Fire hoses, buckets, and ladders may be stored in fire hose houses. Examples are historical structures that were part of a neighborhood system of firefighting in which responsibility was placed on the individual districts of a city. For more modern structures, housing fire engines and often quarters for firemen, use "fire stations."
owl:Class.rdfs:label: brandslanghuisje
brandslanghuisjes
brandspuithuisje
brandspuithuisjes
fire hose houses

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Forten aangelegd volgens het polygonale stelsel.Het polygonaal stelsel is een manier van het ontwerpen en bouwen van vestingwerken die ontstaan is in de 19e eeuw en waarbij er geen gebruik meer wordt gemaakt van bastions voor flankerend geschut.

Forts having a polygonal shape, which varied according to the site and requirements. Although they existed by the middle ages, prime examples of polygonal forts were those constructed resist the fire of rifled artillery and heavy mortars in the late 18th through 19th centuries.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: polygonaal fort
polygonal forts
polygonale forten

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Areas, often sheltered, located beside a railway track at a station and raised to a level convenient for passengers and freight to be loaded on and off the train, tram, or other similar conveyance.
Platformen of hoge stoepen langs spoorbanen bij stationsgebouwen.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: perron
perrons
perrons (spoorweg)
railway platforms

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Shops that deal in hose and frame-knitted or woven underclothing generally.
Winkels gespecialiseerd in allerlei gebreide en gewezen goederen, garen en band.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: bonneterie
bonneterieën
hosiery shops

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Buildings where a provost, who is a high-ranking administrative officer in an ecclesiastical or academic institution, resides.
Een proosdij is de ambtswoning van een 'proost' of het gebouw waarin de administratie van een proosdij of kapittel zetelt.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: proosdij
proosdijen
provost's houses

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Gaten, of putten die zijn vervaardigd door te boren.
Holes drilled into the earth as exploratory wells or more generally in the service of construction.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: boorput
boorputten
bore-holes

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Verticaal houten raamwerk bij invaart van sluizen en bruggen om de schepen bij het invaren te geleiden. Ze bieden ook een plaats voor de schepen om aan te meren als ze wachten op doorgang. Korte remmingwerken worden ook 'geleidewerk' of 'aanvaarhoofd' genoemd; ze zijn namelijk te kort om een schip op af te stoppen.

Vertical, often wooden, structures to help align water borne vessels as they approach a lock or a bridge. Guidewalls guide the vessel into the lock chamber or between the piers of the bridge. These also provide a place for the vessels to tie-off while awaiting entry to a lock chamber.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: aanvaarhoofd
aanvaarhoofden
geleidewerk
geleidewerken
guidewalls
remmingwerk
remmingwerken

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Bars or counters in clubs, shops, or elsewhere where wine is kept or sold, usually a licensed establishment specializing in the serving of wine, often accompanied by food offerings.
Een café gespecialiseerd in wijnen. In een bodega werden oorspronkelijk alleen of hoofdzakelijk Spaanse wijnen verkocht.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: bodega
bodega's
wijnbar
wijnbars
wijnhuis
wijnhuizen
wijnlokaal
wijnlokalen
wijntaperij
wijntapperijen
wine bars

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Bouwwerken met apparatuur voor de bediening van seinen en wissels van een spoorweg.
Railroad signal towers that are of modest size and house-like in form.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: railroad signal houses
seinhuis
seinhuizen

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Hallen voor aankomende reizigers op luchthavens en havens.
Halls for ingress at a destination or transportation hub for watercraft, trains, or aircraft.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: aankomsthal
aankomsthallen
arrival terminals

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Almshouses built surrounding a courtyard. Unique to the Netherlands, these are intended as housing for the elderly, primarily single women, and are administered as charitable institutions originally financed as legacies by wealthy individuals, or founded by municipal authorities.
Geheel van om een binnentuin gelegen kleine huisjes, oorspronkelijk voor armen. Mannen en vrouwen leefden gescheiden.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: godshuis
godshuizen
hofje
hofjes
hofjes
oudemannenhuis
oudemannenhuizen
oudevrouwenhuis
oudevrouwenhuizen

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Buildings that may be adapted to many types of events such as concerts, meetings, or sporting events.
Gebouw dat bestemd is voor allerlei culturele manifestaties en sportgebeurtenissen
owl:Class.rdfs:label: evenementenhal
evenementenhallen
multi-purpose halls

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Intermediate stopping places along lightrail tram routes.
Tussenstations van lokale tramlijnen
owl:Class.rdfs:label: tram stations
tramstation
tramstations

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Hoge stellages voor de opslag van oogstproducten als hooi en ongedorst graan, bestaande uit een langs een, of meerdere, verticale palen verschuifbare kap.
Structures for storing hay, with roofs that can be raised or lowered for protection from the elements. Some are set on skids to be moved wherever they are needed.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: hay barracks
hooiberg
hooibergen
kapberg
kapbergen
schuurberg
schuurbergen

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Gebruik voor versterkte huizen met een oorsprong in de middeleeuwen die werden gebouwd in het noorden van Nederland en Duitsland. Het steenhuis is een nagenoeg vierkant bouwwerk met zijden van 9 tot 12 meter, gebouwd van baksteen. Oorspronkelijke steenhuizen zijn zeldzaam. Ze werden later vaak uitgebouwd tot landhuizen, of het materiaal werd hergebruikt voor andere doeleinden.

Refers to distinctive, rural fortified dwellings of relatively modest size; particularly, but not exclusively, those dating from the 13th century and later in northern Europe. These "stone houses" were typically owned by local minor lords or land holders; they were usually made of stone. Do not use this term to indicate common houses made of the material stone; instead, use material = "stone (worked rock)" plus work type = "house."
owl:Class.rdfs:label: borg
borgen
steenhuis
steenhuizen
stins
stinsen
stone houses (fortified rural dwellings)

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Continuous, concatenated or otherwise related defenses, usually with obstacles such as inundations, trenches, ramparts, ditches, barbed wire, minefields or tank obstacles.

Lineair stelsel van doorgaande, aaneengeschakelde of anderszins samenhangende verdedigingswerken, veelal voorzien van hindernissen zoals inundaties, grachten, prikkeldraadversperringen, mijnenvelden en tankhindernissen.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: lines (defensive works)
linie
linies
linies (verdedigingswerken)

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Reeks van verdedigingswerken die (deels) gedekt zijn door onder water gezette (geïnundeerde) gebieden. Dit type linie is specifiek voor Nederlands grondgebied
Series of defenses covered by flooding. This type of defense was practiced in the Netherlands with its many waterways and polders.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: inundation lines
waterlinie
waterlinies

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Kapel terzijde van een kerkschip of koor.
Subsidiary chapels opening off the nave or side aisles of basilican churches. For chapels opening off the apse, prefer "apse chapels."
owl:Class.rdfs:label: schipkapel
schipkapellen
side chapels
zijkapel
zijkapellen

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Mills designed to grind trass, a kind of rock which when ground is used for making mortar or hydraulic cement.
Molens waar tufsteen of gebrande klei tot tras wordt gemalen.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: trasmolen
trasmolens
trass mills

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Rooms or offices where medical and paramedical professions, particularly those of general practitioners, are practiced, patients examined, and treatment prescribed. Originally, these may have been in private houses, now most often they are offices in urban districts.

Ruimten voor de uitoefening van medische en paramedische beroepen, oorspronkelijk alleen aan huis, nu ook in bijvoorbeeld wijkgebouwen. Gebruik eventueel in combinatie met een specifieke beroepsgroep, bijvoorbeeld 'fysiotherapeuten' en 'praktijkruimten'.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: praktijkruimte
praktijkruimten
surgeries (health facilities)

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Afgesloten loopplaatsen voor kippen die aan de hokken vastzitten.
Open, bounded areas adjacent to coops or hen houses designated for the exercise and feeding of hens.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: chicken runs
kippenren
kippenrennen

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Distinctive fortified towers associated with civic buildings in northern Europe. Examples are towers at town halls or market halls, often housing bells and a clock, in Belgium and northern France.

Versterkte toren, afzonderlijk staand of verbonden met een stadhuis of stedelijke markthal (lakenhal), waarin de stadsklokken waren opgehangen. Vrijwel alle nog bestaande belforten bevinden zich in België en Noord-Frankrijk.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: belfort
belforten
belforten (torens)
belforts

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Een bovenkruier is een windmolen waarbij alleen de kap met het wiekenkruis in het horizontale vlak kan draaien.
Windmills in which the cap and sails are rotated to accommodate wind direction. For windmills that rotate the entire body of the structure, use "post mills."
owl:Class.rdfs:label: bovenkruier
bovenkruiers
cap winders

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Klein verdedigingswerk voor de controle van belangrijke doorgangen, zoals grote verkeerswegen of spoorwegen, bij bruggen, rivierovergangen, bergpassen.

Small defensive fortifications used as a gun emplacement or observation point; used in battle situations and routinely to command control of a site. Examples are pillboxes made of concrete that were used in battlefield defensive systems during World War I.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: pillboxes (military structures)
sperfort
sperforten

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Een rustieke gebouwtje, dat de indruk maakte dat het zou kunnen worden bewoond door een kluizenaar.

Rustic buildings built as follies, usually as part of an estate, from rough materials, intended to appear as the habitations of a hermits. These are rarely intended to be permanent dwelling and are distinguished from the habitations of true hermits, ascetics, or recluses.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: hermitage
hermitages
hermitages (follies)
hermitages (tuinelementen)
kluizenaarshut
kluizenaarshutten

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Buildings occupied by the office of a chancellor and where charters and other documents are prepared or issued.
Gebouw waar het bureau van de kanselier zetelde en waar de oorkondes en andere documenten van een bepaalde vorst of andere bestuurlijke instelling werden opgesteld, bezegeld en uitgevaardigd.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: chancelleries (government office buildings)
kanselarij
kanselarijen

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: 'Grachten' rondom de 'hoofdwallen'van vestingwerken.
The moats surrounding the main ramparts of fortifications.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: hoofdgracht
hoofdgrachten
kapitale grachten
main moats

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Grachten tussen 'ravelijnen' en 'contrescarpes'.
In a fortification, ditches or moats located between the ravelins and the counterscarps.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ravelijnsgracht
ravelijnsgrachten
ravelin ditches

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Windmills with fixed caps that are placed on a central vertically oriented pole axis and can be revolved in their entirety to face the prevailing winds.
windmolen met vaste kap die in zijn geheel op rollen draait
owl:Class.rdfs:label: onderkruier
onderkruiers
post mills

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Molen waarbij het verkruien van de kap binnen gebeurt. Op de kapzolder is hiertoe het kruiwerk aangebracht.
Windmills in which the caps are turned by a winch inside the cap itself.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: binnenkruier
binnenkruiers
inside winders

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Post mills having a shorter central post, and developed specifically as sawmills.
Specifiek type onderkruier meestal een zaagmolen met ingebouwde werkvloer die eind 17e eeuw werd geïntroduceerd.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: paltrokmolen
paltrokmolens
paltroks

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Windmills having the form of a masonry tower, atop which are positioned a rotating cap and the sails.
Windmolen in de gedaante van een ronde, stenen gemetselde recht opgaande toren.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: torenmolen
torenmolens
tower mills

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Molen voorzien van een stelling of omloop ondersteund door stutten.
Windmills, often tower mills or smock mills in form, distinguished by having an exterior platform or gallery wrapped around the circumference.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: baliemolens
gallery mills
stellingmolen
stellingmolens

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Water mills that function by water flowing into buckets on a wheel from the top, causing it to rotate in the same direction as the water flows.
Watermolen waarbij het water over het rad heen valt, waardoor dit in dezelfde richting draait als de waterstroom.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: bovenslagmolen
bovenslagmolens
overshot mills

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Buildings that house organizations or businesses that present independent films with artistic rather than commercial appeal including foreign or experimental films, or revivals of older releases.
Meestal kleinere bioscopen die zich richten op het alternatieve , niet-commerciële filmaanbod.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: art house cinemas (buildings)
filmhuis
filmhuizen
filmtheater
filmtheaters

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Substantial bell towers associated with a church or public building, or rooms in the bell tower where the bells are hung or the ringers stand.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: belfries (spaces)

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Structures designed and used for drying products, such as fruit, vegetables, meat, fish, tobacco, paper, bricks, or any number of other products. Typical features include slats or vents for ease of air flow and a hearth used for a drying fire.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: drying houses

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Subsidiary chapels opening off the apse of churches. For chapels opening off the nave or side aisles, prefer "side chapels."
owl:Class.rdfs:label: apse chapels

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Subsidiary chapels opening off the center of the apse of churches, on an axis down the center of the plan.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: axial chapels

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Subsidiary chapels opening off the transept of a cruciform-plan church.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: transept chapels

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Subsidiary chapels opening off the rounded apse of a church, having a footprint resembling petals or rays extending from the rounded apse.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: radiating chapels

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Windmills that stand on artificial rises instead of being elevated on brickwork.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: elevated mills

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Wheels with mounted sails that rotate in a horizontal plane, around a vertical axis. The design is of ancient Asian origin, originally used for pumping water.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: vertical windwheels

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Structures that house signals of various types, usually in service of transportation systems; examples include such structures on seashores, canals, or along railroad lines.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: signal houses

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: In Britain, Europe, and European colonies, a great house is the grand dwelling of a landed proprietor, usually the largest or principal house in the district.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: great houses (European country houses)

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Private houses where members of a particular religious organization or group meet to pray. Types of house churches include "domus ecclesiae" of the early Christians, protestant worship places in China, and any other meeting places of modern sects or religious organizations whose ceremonies and activities take place in the houses of its members, rather than in a purpose-built church.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: house churches

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: In certain large mosques, raised platforms where the müezzin, the assistant of the imam, repeats the call to prayer at the start of each service, reads from the Koran, kneels to respond to the imam's prayers, etc.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: müezzin mahfilis

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Covered market spaces where meat is sold.
Overdekte marktplaats waar vlees verhandeld wordt
owl:Class.rdfs:label: meat halls
vleeshal
vleeshallen

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Covered market spaces where fish is sold as a food product, either wholesale, at auction near ports, or piecemeal as part of a market complex in a town or city.
Overdekte marktplaats waar vis verhandeld wordt
owl:Class.rdfs:label: fish halls
vishal
vishallen

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Built works that have been damaged, lost, or destroyed, then built or heavily restored at a later time according to the same design, usually but not always on the original site. Includes built works that have been physically reconstructed, as well as the subject matter of drawings, models, or other media illustrating a surmised reconstruction.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: reconstructed architecture

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: In the Catholic church, a term used by canon lawyers and liturgists as a title. It was assigned to certain churches as an honorific, the character of which was not always very clearly defined. Basilicas in this sense are divided into two classes, the greater or patriarchal, and the lesser, basilicas. For built works having a basilican floor plan, use "basilicas (works by form)."
owl:Class.rdfs:label: basilicas (works by context)

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Towers intended to afford views of the surrounding area, typically for the purpose of the enjoyment of views rather than for defense.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: observation towers

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Places where medicines may be prepared on-site, dispensed, and or sold. Pharmacies are often sited within modern drugstores that sell a variety of products, though they may also exist outside of this context.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: pharmacies (health facilities )

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Shops in which apothecaries plied their trade, preparing and dispensing medicinal substances, as well as sundry items including confections, candles, spices, or cordials.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: apothecary's shops

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Large, stately, or ornamental tents or tent-like coverings, usually rising to a central point rather than a ridge.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: pavilions (tents)

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Korean gates used to mark the entrance to sacred sites such as royal tombs; having a light design comprising red columns and simple wooden rods arranged vertically.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: hongsalmuns

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Gates serving a largely ceremonial purpose.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ceremonial gates

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Combined residential and commercial structures built with a shop that opens on to the ground floor pavement with a second or third storey generally used as a residence for the proprietor. These are most commonly found in Singapore, Malaysia, and China, but the form exists elsewhere, often in "Chinatown" developments in American cities, referring back to the original source.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: shophouses

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Temporary fortifications, parapets, or galleries of wood erected on the battlements of fortresses, historically erected in the anticipation of a seige.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: brattices

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Places at which material such as wool, ore, coal, or crushed stone is separated from impurities or dust by washing in water or other liquids.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: washeries

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Places at which coal is separated from impurities or dust by washing in water or other liquids.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: coal washeries

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Industrial building facilities in which chocolate, or chocolate confectionery, is produced.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: chocolate factories

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A class of enigmatic neolithic monuments that are comprised of parallel banks with ditches at their outside edges. These may have squared or curved ends terminated with additional external mounds, and are found running across land, often for long distances. They represent some of the oldest prehistoric monumental structures of the islands of Britain and Ireland.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cursus monuments

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Poultry houses where broilers are raised, which are chickens raised for meat rather than for egg-laying. In large commercial facilities, the birds are often raised in close confinement.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: broiler houses

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Chambers, usually subterranean, containing deceased remains and other related funerary items.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: burial vaults

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Relatively small shelters for chickens, usually chickens raised for laying eggs, who are brought into the shelter for safety overnight.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: chicken coops

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Simple structures for sheltering or housing livestock.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: livestock sheds

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Sheds to shelter sheep.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: sheep sheds

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Buildings that house businesses that sell art, whether the merchandise is actually displayed in the shop or stored elsewhere, with images used to communicate with the buyers.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: art stores

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Altars upon which offerings for the dead are displayed in Mexico and related cultures, in homes or cemeteries, particularly for Day of the Dead celebrations.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ofrendas (altars)

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Indonesian religious structures based on an Indianized shrine with a pyramidal tower. This was the essential form on which virtually all the stone Indianizing architecture of Southeast Asia was originally based. The Javanese, like the Khmer, evolved an elaborate architecture of their own around the basic Indian prototype.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: candis

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: General term for places where pigs are kept or bred.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: piggeries

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Pens in which pigs are enclosed or housed.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: pigpens

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: In animal husbandry, buildings or enclosures for maintaining flocks of domestic fowl laying hens, usually chickens; may contain nests, lighting, roosting space, waterers, and feed troughs.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: laying houses

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Covered carts, huts, or tents, mounted on wheels by which they can be rolled into shallow water at the seaside or lake shore, for the purpose of allowing swimmers to enter the water modestly, without appearing in public in bathing suits. May be horse-driven or pushed by hand. Bathing machines were popular in 18th-19th-century Europe.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: bathing machines (carts)

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Structures or other places of adode that are more than merely temporary, and serve as the usual dwellings of people while at a certain place. In a legal sense, a person may have multiple residences, but only one "domicile," which is their primary dwelling for legal purposes.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: residences

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Structures or other places of adode; in a legal sense, a domicile is the primary dwelling of a person, their fixed or permanent location.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: domiciles

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Structures or other places that are people's house or abode, the fixed residence of a family or household, or otherwise the physical seat of domestic life and interests. For the abstract concept of the center of an individual's domestic life, personal relationships, and interests, together with the feeling of comfort and satisfaction that it conveys, use "home (concept)."
owl:Class.rdfs:label: homes

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: In ancient Rome, a small, portable altar where perfumes were burnt, placed before the dead.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: acerras (altars)

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Refers to barriers for the subdivision of churches into areas of differing function and liturgical significance.
Verwijst naar afscheidingen bedoeld om kerken onder te verdelen in ruimten met verschillende functies of van groter of kleiner liturgisch belang.

scherm of hek in christelijk religieus gebouw
